abstract: Hong Kong Chief Exec Leung Chun-ying, while describing measures intended to address housing shortages and subdue public anger over housing and inequality in city, cautions that making concessions to protestors could court anarchy; housing shortages and related concessions to wealthy citizens were among issues raised by protestors who occupied Hong Kong streets for 11 weeks in 2014.
lead_paragraph: Leung Chun-ying laid out measures to defuse public anger over housing and inequality that resounded with the protesters who seized streets last year.
snippet: Leung Chun-ying laid out measures to defuse public anger over housing and inequality that resounded with the protesters who seized streets last year.

headline.main: Hong Kong Leader Says Yielding to Protesters Could Stir Chaos
headline.print_headline: Hong Kong Leader Says Yielding to Protesters Could Stir Chaos
